definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Mrs. Dursley sipped her tea through pursed lips.
sentences.chinese: 德思禮太太嘬起嘴脣呷了一口茶。

sentences.english: But, as soon as, he put the pointed arrow in his mouth, it pricked his jaws and went through his head.
sentences.chinese: 可是，它一嘬利箭，箭就衝中它的口，從頭上穿出。

sentences.english: Is the woman ready to bite chicken chicken for man?
sentences.chinese: 女人願意給男人嘬雞雞麼？

sentences.english: The baby sucked away at his bottle contentedly .
sentences.chinese: 那嬰兒舒適地嘬着奶瓶。

sentences.english: Never drink or suck soup loudly.
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要大聲地喝湯或嘬湯。

sentences.english: Hokkaido crab meat relatively soft, gently suck the meat can be imported.
sentences.chinese: 北海道蟹的肉質比較鬆軟，輕輕一嘬，肉就可以入口。

sentences.english: The baby sucked away at its bottle contented ly.
sentences.chinese: 那嬰兒舒適地嘬着奶瓶。

sentences.english: Maybe you still can not control your tongue well.
sentences.chinese: 不用嘬着也能壓出來，可能是你還沒能控制好舌頭。

definition: to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
the corners of the mouth/the lips
sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
(onom.) patter, splatter, click/to smack one's lips/to pull (on a pipe)
to hold with one's mouth (as a smoker with a cigarette or a dog with a bone)
(dialect) to savor/to test the taste of/(fig.) to ponder upon/to mull over
readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
